results.title: Supreme Court Rejects Trump Request to Intervene in Documents Case
results.abstract: Without any noted dissents, the court issued a one-sentence statement that amounted to a rebuke to the former president.

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump has often been infuriated by what he sees as a lack of deference to him by the Supreme Court, to which he has appointed three justices.
media.copyright: Bridget Bennett for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Attacks on Police;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Police;Deaths (Fatalities);Bristol (Conn)
results.byline: By Michael Gold, Corey Kilgannon and Hurubie Meko
results.title: 2 Police Officers Killed in Connecticut After a Suspicious 911 Call
results.abstract: A third officer was seriously wounded in the violence in Bristol, officials said, and a suspect also died. The police chief called it an act of “senseless violence.”

results.adx_keywords: Classified Information and State Secrets;Subpoenas;Search and Seizure;Archives and Records;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;Nauta, Walt;Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach, Fla);National Archives and Records Administration;Federal Bureau of Investigation;Justice Department
results.byline: By Maggie Haberman and Alan Feuer
results.title: Trump Aide Was Seen on Security Footage Moving Boxes at Mar-a-Lago
results.abstract: The aide, Walt Nauta, moved the boxes from a storage room before and after the Justice Department issued a subpoena demanding the return of all classified documents held by the former president.

media.caption: The Justice Department had subpoenaed security camera footage from former President Donald J. Trump’s Mar-a-Lago residence in Palm Beach, Fla.
media.copyright: Saul Martinez for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Frauds and Swindling;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Trump, Donald J;James, Letitia;Trump Organization;New York State
results.byline: By Ben Protess, Jonah E. Bromwich and William K. Rashbaum
results.title: Trump Forms New Company, Drawing Scrutiny From N.Y. Attorney General
results.abstract: The New York attorney general, Letitia James, who is suing the former president, questioned his motive for forming a new company, which will be known in the state as the Trump Organization II.

media.caption: Under scrutiny by the New York attorney general, Donald J. Trump’s business created a new company in Delaware.
media.copyright: Bridget Bennett for The New York Times

results.title: Spelling Bee Forum
results.abstract: Feeling stuck on today’s puzzle? We can help.

results.byline: By Emily Cataneo, Vimal Patel and McKenna Oxenden
results.title: 5 Killed, Including Off-Duty Officer, as Gunman Stalks a Raleigh Neighborhood
results.abstract: A suspect identified as “a white male juvenile” was in custody, the police said. At least two others were wounded, including a police officer, whose injuries were described as “non-life threatening.”

results.title: Teenagers Are Telling Us That Something Is Wrong With America
results.abstract: Adolescents live at the fault lines of a culture, exposing our weak spots.

results.adx_keywords: Conspiracy Theories;Libel and Slander;Decisions and Verdicts;Compensation for Damages (Law);Newtown, Conn, Shooting (2012);Right-Wing Extremism and Alt-Right;United States Politics and Government;Jones, Alex (1974- );Parker, Robbie;Parker, Emilie;Infowars
results.title: ‘We Told the Truth’: Sandy Hook Families Win $1 Billion From Alex Jones
results.abstract: The Sandy Hook families leveraged personal stories, social media analysis and the Infowars fabulist’s lack of contrition to secure a major verdict.

media.caption: Alex Jones faces financial ruin after a jury awarded the families who had sued him almost $1 billion, though it is unclear how much money the families will ultimately collect.
media.copyright: Kirsten Luce for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Decisions and Verdicts;Newtown, Conn, Shooting (2012);Compensation for Damages (Law);Jones, Alex (1974- )
results.title: ‘Do these people actually think they’re getting any money?’ Jones denounces the verdict, and fund-raises.
results.abstract: Broadcasting in tandem with the court hearing, Alex Jones called the $965 million judgment against him a “joke,” and urged his viewers to send him hundreds of thousands of dollars to pay for an appeal.

media.caption: Alex Jones with private security guards after appearing at his Sandy Hook defamation trial last week.

results.title: Nearly Half of Covid Patients Haven’t Fully Recovered Months Later, Study Finds
results.abstract: The findings strengthened calls from scientists for more expansive care options for long Covid patients.

media.caption: A study tracked 33,000 Scottish people who had tested positive for the virus and 63,000 who had never been diagnosed with Covid, checking symptoms at six-month intervals.

results.adx_keywords: Uvalde, Tex, Shooting (May 24, 2022);your-feed-visual-investigations;Arredondo, Pedro;McCraw, Steven C;Police Department (Uvalde, Tex);Border Patrol (US);Public Safety Department (Tex);Texas;Uvalde (Tex)
results.byline: By Robin Stein and Alexander Cardia
results.title: State Investigation Fueled Flawed Understanding of Delays During Police Response in Uvalde
results.abstract: The school police chief was singled out for blame, but a Times visual investigation found that scores of trained officers, including those from an elite Border Patrol unit, took many of the same steps.

results.adx_keywords: Real Estate and Housing (Residential);Celebrities;Brooklyn Heights (Brooklyn, NY)
results.title: Why So Many Celebrities Are Moving to Brooklyn Heights
results.abstract: With stately townhouses and a cute bakery, Brooklyn Heights is shaping up to be the next West Village.

media.caption: Brooklyn Heights offers block after tree-lined block of 19th-century brownstones, plus proximity to Manhattan. Among those calling it home are Matt Damon, Amy Schumer, Adam Driver, Paul Rudd, Keri Russell and Matthew Rhys.
media.copyright: Jonah Rosenberg for The New York Times

results.byline: By Nancy Updike, Jenelle Pifer, Julie Snyder and Sophie Allison of Soccer Mommy
results.title: We Were Three
results.abstract: A story of lies, family, America and what Covid revealed, as well as what it destroyed.

results.byline: By Jill Cowan and Shawn Hubler
results.title: Los Angeles City Councilwoman Resigns Amid Uproar Over Racist Remarks
results.abstract: The former Council president, Nury Martinez, faced calls from state leaders and President Biden to leave office after making racist remarks on a recording that emerged on Sunday.

media.caption: The former Los Angeles City Council president Nury Martinez during a news conference in Los Angeles last month. Ms. Martinez announced her resignation as a councilwoman on Wednesday.
media.copyright: Al Seib/Los Angeles Times via Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Political Prisoners;United States International Relations;Basketball;Griner, Brittney;Whelan, Paul N;Russia
results.byline: By Valerie Hopkins and Michael Crowley
results.title: Brittney Griner Is Increasingly Anxious She May Not Be Freed, Lawyer Says
results.abstract: Facing nine years in prison in Russia, the U.S. basketball star is struggling emotionally and worried that a swap deal to release her may not materialize, according to one of her attorneys.

media.caption: Brittney Griner at a court outside Moscow in August. The United States has said that her detention and trial were politically motivated.

results.abstract: The pair had stuffed walleye fish with lead balls at an Ohio fishing tournament last month in an attempt to win nearly $30,000, prosecutors said.
